Job Description:
Snapshot
You are a Quality Assurance Tester with a real passion for ensuring quality and a dedicated, can-do, attitude to overcoming technical and process challenges. To succeed in this role you will have experience as a professional games tester.
The Team
DeepMind's mission is to "Solve intelligence. Use it to make the world a better place." The Worlds Team provides DeepMind Researchers with the best training and testing environments possible. These range from bespoke mini-games aimed at answering specific research questions, to expansive first-person environments using modern game engines. The Worlds Team is important in helping steer DeepMind's research forward.
We design and implement our learning environments carefully as it's likely we'll live with them for many years to come so we apply thoughtfulness to everything we do. We take robust design and implementation seriously to ensure the delivery of high quality, repeatable, research environments. You'll join a close-knit team of hardworking individuals who openly share ideas with one another. Projects we've worked on include AlphaGo, DM Lab, and DQN on Atari as well as contributions to countless publications. You will not need prior machine learning experience for this role.
DeepMind's AI systems are the best in the world and they have surprised the world by learning to play video games, mastering the ancient Chinese game of Go, and making inroads into solving protein folding. They are trained to perform visual processing tasks, exhibit cognitive abilities like memory and planning, and can learn to control physical bodies. Much of what you know is of huge value to us as we strive towards building the challenges that are used as training environments for increasingly general-purpose learning systems, but there will also be much you will need to learn about the process of learning itself.
If this challenge intrigues you, then get in touch.

About The Role
As a QA Tester on our team you will be part of a small but growing team of testers/games players. The duties of the team are two fold:
Testing and validation of the games, platforms and tasks created by the Worlds and Research teams.
Recording scores and play sessions in a wide variety of games from classic console games and bespoke mini games to modern 3D games. The data recorded will be used for scientific research purposes in novel and exciting ways.
Responsibilities include:
Collaborating with engineers, the QA lead, researchers and designers to ensure the research requirements are met and the tasks are of sufficient quality.
Finding and reporting issues in a clear and accurate manner.
Provide feedback and produce detailed test plans and test cases.
Run bug reviews.
Set reference scores for games used for research.
About You
Minimum requirements:
QA testing experience.
Familiarity with popular games across a variety of genres and platforms.
A real passion for both automated and manual testing.
Ability to work with diverse groups of people with different requirements and ways of working.
Preferred/Nice to have:
Unity3d experience.
Python and C# knowledge
Passionate about functional testing
Opening date: 10th November 2020
Closing date: 8th December 2020
DeepMind welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.
Competitive salary applies.

Job Description:
We are looking for a QA Tester/ Engineer for our growing IT delivery team. We are looking for someone that is passionate and a creative problem-solver, with an exceptionally high attention to detail. The right individual not only finds bugs, but plays a leading role in understanding the Customer requirements and working closely with the broader QA and development teams to identify acceptance criteria. They will follow the customer QA process as an extension of the current team. Their involvement will range from design to deployment to ensure we deliver the highest quality systems and features.

Responsibility:
Take direct responsibility for the quality of our teams output.
Work within the cusotmer's QA team to deliver exceptional work from the Syentec Team/s
Understanding business, system and feature requirements.
Validating requirements with the solution consultants, product owners and development team
Identifying, agreeing and documenting appropriate acceptance criteria
Creating and maintaining appropriate regression tests
Professionally and thoroughly executing regression tests and reporting results internally and externally
Identifying and recommending improvements to the Synetec processes in order to improve our teams quality
Increase the adoption of automated testing
Requirements
Happy to move quickly and independently. Take ownership of the outlined goals and make things happen.
Commercial experience working on collaborative engineering teams
Experience with test driven development. You also love to work with an engineering team to automate testing and then create tools so the team can test their own code
Strong experience and deep understanding of testing RESTful APIs including Authentication & Authorisation, API responses and API response codes
Commercial experience with any unit testing frameworks (NUnit, JUnit, xUnit, or similar)
Commercial experience with any test automation tools (Selenium Webdriver, Appium, Espresso, MSTest, Coded UI, Cucumber, FitNesse, Testium)
Hands on experience with web technologies (HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, jQuery)
Experience in Accessiblity Automation Testing (aXe, Selenuim, Wave)
Experience in cross browser and device testing (crossbrowsertesting)
Knowledge of Object Oriented Programming, Web Service testing, Front-End UI automation and have built a Test Automation framework yourself. Implemented testing Builds for Continuous Integration
Ability to write SQL queries as well as stored procedures and perform back-end testing
Exposure to Azure DevOps
Very organized, able to meet and keep track of tight deadlines with lots of moving parts
Know how to get things done, possessing a keen sense of urgency and the ability to prioritize problems, and analyse and resolve issues
Excellent written and spoken English
Minimum of 3 years commercial testing experience
Benefits
Culture of inclusivity
Up-skill/Training opportunities
Office hours will be 9am to 6pm
Permanent position
Great Location in London near London Bridge, Southwark and Waterloo stations
Starting ASAP. There will be some remote working due to COVID restrictions
Generous Leave Allowance 23 days leave as well as all working days between Christmas and New Years Day
Private Healthcare after qualifying period
Generous salary depending on experience

About Us:

Motion Pictures Solutions (MPS) is a leading international film services company, providing end-to-end solutions at all stages in the field of theatrical film delivery. From 24/7 post-production and mastering through to secure electronic distribution, KDM delivery, live event management, creative services and specialist technical consultancy, MPS offers distributors, exhibitors and industry partners a culture of innovation, a high level of expertise and fast turnaround times.

MPS has spent the past 15 years building a company that major Film Studios and Distributors trust. We’re a leading company at what we do and our aim is to make the global cinema industry run better, with our software already forming the basis of that ambition. We want to drive the cinema industry forward using the power of new, secure web-based technologies.

MPS is an energetic company and we guarantee a fun workplace and maybe the odd movie in one of our state-of the-art screening rooms. Most of all we want ambitious, driven people who are passionate about technology and film.

The Role:

To ensure software quality and reliability, which includes software testing, playing a leading role in Process Improvement, performing quality assurance and audit activities and by working closely with product and departmental managers to identify non-conformances and assist in the implementation of cost effective, timely solutions.

Key Responsibilities:
Write and execute manual test plans
Identify suitable test data and write acceptance tests
Test across multiple devices and platforms
Identify and execute complex test scenarios
Identify root causes of defects and ensure measures are taken to correct issues
Perform adequate fault logging, escalation and monitoring
Maintain automated test profiles
Encourage, support and coach other team members in their own development
Maintain a positive and solution-oriented approach to work, providing open and honest feedback


Requirements

Qualifications
ISTQB Certified Tester Foundation Level
Experience:
Min. 2 years of experience working in a fast paced agile environment
Experience with writing and executing manual test plans
Experience of non-functional testing e.g. Performance, usability, accessibility etc.
Skills and Knowledge:
Good understanding of Scrum, Kanban and Jira (or other agile toolsets)
Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) & Software Testing Lifecycle(STLC) experience
Experience/exposure of performance, unit, security, penetration, scalability /stress and load testing (Non-functional requirements)
Experience of testing APIs and familiar with tools for testing APIs(Swagger/Postman)
Be comfortable using the command line (Unix/Linux)
Working closely with developers on functional tests and coordinating test/release branches in Git for deployment
Profound understanding of modern QA methodologies and practices.
Jira
GIT – Source Control

Self-Starter
Strong communication skills
Desirable:
Media file formats and metadata files such as XML

JavaScript programming language

Who we are
We are digital healthcare in the palm of your hand. We are clinical excellence in just a few taps. We are doctors, designers and data analysts. Software developers, managers and marketers. And we’re changing the GP experience – forever.

No more waiting for appointments. No more waiting rooms. With Doctor Care Anywhere, you speak to a doctor when it suits you, by video or phone call from anywhere.
But this is just the beginning.

We have ambitious goals and need ambitious people to reach them. If you’re talented, hard-working and make a habit out of dreaming big, we’d like to hear from you.

The role:
We are seeking a Manual Tester to join our dynamic and motivated team in order to Reduce the number of bugs reaching the production environment and ensure quality of Production releases for both web and mobile applications.

The key tasks in your new role with us
To ensure the release delivers applications of a quality that meets business requirements, are valuable to end users and are fit for purpose
Work closely with project stakeholders to prioritise and resolve bugs while delivering continuous feedback during the development process
Support in the creation, maintenance and implementation of test plans and scenarios

3+ years of software quality assurance engineering experience
Knowledge of QA methodology and industry-standard testing and bug tracking tools
Experience with one scripting language

Are you interested in shaping the future of what people watch on television? Amazon Fire TV Edition team is looking for experienced, results-oriented Software Quality Assurance Engineers who are capable of translating high-level, ambiguous business goals into working software solutions. We own the voice experience on all of our streaming media players, and are constantly experimenting and innovating to improve the customer experience. Successful candidates are creative engineers who take great pride in both the technical and business contribution of their work and are passionate about great software and ultimately a great customer experience.
You will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies from front-end UI (both web and device) to back-end distributed web services to device software. You will own the quality of major deliverables end-to-end, working closely with multiple engineers and teams to execute them. Scaling, latency, and customer experience are top priorities as the business grows. This is a high visibility team where you will make a direct positive impact on customer experience and the business. If you enjoy broadening your technical skills, building a new product, and working in an environment that thrives on creativity, experimentation, and innovation, then this is the job for you!
Quality Assurance Engineers test code at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. Our QA Engineers are not pure black box testers; they test at the appropriate level and are able to understand software internals, debug problems using log files, and write automated tests with scripts and/or user-level automated tools. QA Engineers work with Software Development Engineers, and Business Owners to understand technical implementation of features. QA Engineers will also work with groups such as Product Management, User Interaction, and Customer Support to understand customer usage models and develop test plans and suites that approximate real-world environments and regression tests and driving the software development process towards quality focused methodologies, always seeking to avoid defects or find them earlier in the process.

BS degree, preferably in Computer Science, engineering or other technical field
Experience with Python scripting or other automation framework
Experience with usability best practices; able to influence and improve user experience
Experience with Android, iOS or other mobile application development or testing
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Hudl is changing the future of sports technology, our mission is to capture and bring value to every moment in sports.

We build video analytics platforms and hardware products for teams around the world, at every level of the sporting world. Our software provides six million coaches and players the insights they need to win. To help our users, we need an automation focused QA Engineer, who will work with a small cross-functional team (PM, Engineers, Designer) to build a quality product.

We are using a BDD solution for our API and UI layer tests that focuses on the Gherkin language and backed by python and selenium webdriver. Our QA Engineers test like our users, write automation, evaluate root causes, know the difference between testing and quality and deploy code to production. They are involved throughout the entire development process, frequently pairing to achieve higher quality outcomes.

We work in a Teams and Squads model and follow Scrum. You would be working in the Elite Team, their focus is on professional teams and the unique coaching requirements they have. Your Squad's current project is building new features for the Replay product - an application used by coaches pitch side during matches and training sessions to provide insights and aid tactical decision making. The work can be varied and comprises mobile, thick client and web applications.

As the world's best sports teams start a match, your work will have impacted their preparation, change how they make in-game decisions and help them assess their post-match performance.

Our environment here at Hudl is tech/product orientated first and foremost. We have a values based culture that places an importance on autonomy and creating a relaxed 'nice' place to work. Our management style is based on coaching and ensure you have the tools and a pathway to succeed.

During COVID we are all working remotely. Once things are back to normal, we'd like you to be commutable to our office in London but there will be flexibility on how much you are required to come into the office.

You Are
Technical. You have experience implementing service and UI level automation
Naturally Curious. You discover edge scenarios and are constantly digging in to learn more about features and use cases.
Constantly Learning. You are passionate about learning and are hungry for new ideas.
User-Focused. You think critically about the user experience and adapt your testing to user workflows.
Quality Focused. You promote and maintain a high standard of quality beyond testing.
Risk Aware. You can evaluate risk and design a testing approach to mitigate risk to ensure adequate coverage.
Eager. Keen to work alongside senior Engineers and learn from them.
You Will
Work. In an autonomous squad, following Scrum methodology.
Think like a user. Everyone at Hudl is expected to interact with our users directly.
Test. Use your customer and system understanding to create testing approach and plans.
Evaluate. You will evaluate the root cause of issues and recommend corrective action to address it.
Automate. You will use your skills to assess what to automate and design service and UI layer automation to ensure adequate coverage.
Ship. You will test, talk with users, evaluate trends and deploy code on a frequent basis.
We Will
We Will Treat you like an adult. We will trust you to get the work done and take a break when you need it. Use your unlimited holiday when and how you want and enjoy our flexible work culture.
Give you what you need. We will supply the environment and tools for success, allowing you to focus on professional growth and career development.
Help you to grow. We promise you'll be surrounded by people equally committed to the company's success.
Delight You. We get great perks, like tickets to see our customers and funding that you can spend on your own development.
Diversity at Hudl


We believe that sport has the power to inspire people of all ages and backgrounds. It creates communities that are united in their goals, dedicated and adhere to a universal set of values. At Hudl, we operate the same way and look to build engaged diverse teams that reflect our user base.

Would you like to work for a company that`s at the heart of providing cutting edge pharmacy technology?

Do you have a keen eye for detail and accuracy?

Do you have previous software testing experience with some exposure to SQL and are looking to enhance your career?

Sounds like you? Then read on...

Your new role

As our QA tester, you’ll provide quality control and functional testing of our innovative solutions and products: ProScript Connect, Clinical Service Hub, ePOS - just to name a few.

You’ll get involved in all aspects of the full testing lifecycle, so plenty of exposure of end to end testing. This will include creating and executing both manual and automated test scripts and scenarios of both our newly created and updated modules, to identify any differences in the product and logging in Team Foundation Server (TFS). You’ll work closely with development and clinical teams, communicating any software bugs and issues that you’ve found and making sure they’re resolved.

The role is a fixed term contact.

The team you’ll join

The Quality Assurance team is committed to be a skilled and motivated quality assurance team, delivering high quality and high value products, efficiently and predictably. We work in an agile manner in the UK and India. Your role will require you to join up with other teams, such as pharmacy, PMO, Product owners and development so it`s really important that you`re a team player and enjoy working alongside other people. That being said, you`ll be surrounded by plenty of talented people, who`ll share their expertise and skills with you, to help you succeed in your role.

What you’ll bring

We want to make sure you’re set for success so the key skills we are looking for in the role are below;

You’ll be an experienced software tester who knows Agile software engineering methodologies and processes
You’ll have your ISTQB Foundation Level qualification
You’ll have great knowledge of SQL and .Net

What we’ll give you

As well as a competitive salary, you’ll get a benefits package which includes a pension, life assurance and far more!

We also take our corporate social responsibility pretty seriously and we believe in giving back to our community, so you’ll get the chance to be involved in lots of fundraising events throughout the year. In the past, these have included challenge to complete up to a 100km walk over 24hrs across the Peak District and a walk over the Yorkshire Three Peaks!

So if this snapshot of the role looks interesting, click apply. If you don’t apply now, the job may vanish, but don’t panic; sign up for our job alerts and we’ll keep you updated.

It is an ideal place for a candidate who is ambitious, hardworking, loves animals, is looking to rapidly progress their career and would enjoy working in a vibrant environment with smart co-workers and friendly office dogs! With a currently strong foothold in the United States, in the next several years, the Company intends to rapidly establish a presence across Europe and Asia. This exciting growth/hyper-scale will be underpinned by a continually evolving bedrock of proprietary product formulations which will improve pet and owner lives. DESCRIPTION –

To be a source of knowledge, expertise, information, guidance and coaching on all aspects of Quality System Management. In particular provide expertise and support to the organization regarding quality assurance of suppliers and design control.

RESPONSIBILITIES –
Support the implementation of Elekta Quality Policy, other directives and processes throughout the Elekta Solutions quality system and organization.

A BIT ABOUT SEGA


SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our five development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.

At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Tech, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.

Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.

WORKING THE SEGA WAY


We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours…
For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our lunchtime gaming sessions in our games lounge, regular gaming tournaments and free SEGA games on Steam
If you're more of a foodie, you can take advantage of Icecream Wednesdays or our fresh fruit and cereal every single day
Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership, ride to work scheme, workout area and bootcamps in the park. You can find your zen with weekly yoga classes as well as in-house massage therapy
You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be
We hold regular lunch & learn sessions, company updates at the world-famous BAFTA theatre in Central London and Summer and Christmas parties that you’ll want to brag to your mates about! What’s not to love?
We pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of the office
We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!
And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Check out our Careers website to find out why we are a workplace you’ll never want to leave!

Your new role

The International Quality for Alexa team focuses on expanding Alexas capabilities on a global scale. We take on the unique challenge of understanding the nuances of how Alexa enabled devices can serve customers needs in different cultures and locations. If you are interested in shaping the future of Alexa for customers around the world, come and join our team.

The Role:
The Quality Assurance Techs (QAT's) work on testing Devices at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. QAT's at Amazon are excellent individual contributors capable of taking on tasks of test case execution from start to completion with minimal help. QAT's are responsible for understanding the product in detail, and updating the test case tool with test execution results. They write and maintain black- box test cases based on well- defined feature requirements, writing tests cases (not test plans) that are high quality, high value, and maintainable. QAT's also have experience with gray box, and white box testing techniques; they are able to understand software internals, debug problems using log files and reproduce errant product behavior to assist developers or other testers and identify, track, and accurately report defects found. QAT's produce good reproducible defect reports to verify fixed bugs are truly fixed. Develop and execute automated tests and test plans.

Responsibilities:
- Execution of a set of test cases assigned to you by a test lead
- Identifying critical bugs
- Delivering reproducible defect reports that include steps to reproduce, logs, clear description of actual results vs. expected, helpful title / summary
- Gaining knowledge of the features and detailed functional requirements of the work well enough to execute your assigned tests
- Prioritization of own work with help from your manager, operating with limited discretion
- Keeping team members informed of issues that affect you and escalating concerns promptly and appropriately with limited guidance from your manager or team members
- Ability to manage directly assigned tasks and on-call duties gracefully

Basic Qualifications

· BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
- Verbal fluency in French and English
- Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience of 2 or more years
- Demonstrated experience working as part of a team against deadlines with multiple stakeholders
- Demonstrated use at the consumer level of software, computers and devices

Preferred Qualifications

· Sustained coursework, or certificate of completion in Computer Science or related technical field
· Demonstrated experience prioritizing your own work with limited guidance from your manager or peers
· Excellent customer experience intuition; demonstrated success in delivering a world-class customer experience (ideally in the consumer electronics industry)
· Strong organizational skills, tracking multiple projects simultaneously and be able to synthesize the results
· Attention to details and ability to root cause important issues impacting process or customers

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

At Hasbro we are looking for people who want to explore, experiment, innovate, and create. Hasbro's Quality Assurance team is seeking an Associate Reliability Engineer!

Our Quality Assurance team plays a critical role in delivering Hasbro’s mission of making the world a better place for all children and all families, ensuring that all of Hasbro’s products are safe, compliant, and reliable.

In this role, you will be responsible to help drive Hasbro’s mission by working as a cross-functional team member on several Hasbro product lines.

With the support of the QA team, the Associate Reliability Engineer will be responsible for reviewing toy and game concepts throughout development, identifying product risks, assigning appropriate test specifications, and ensuring acceptable test results.

This role will partner with a wide range of cross-functional teams in our corporate offices including Design and Development, Marketing, Operations, Consumer Care, and Legal. Additionally, you will partner closely with Quality Assurance team members in Hong Kong, China, and other locations around the globe close to our product vendors.

A Day in the Life of an Associate Reliability Engineer:
Learn about Hasbro’s product development process and the role of each team member.
Meet with Quality Assurance team members to discuss lessons learned from past products.
Attend training to learn more about Hasbro’s Safety and Reliability Specifications (SRSs), which outline safety, compliance, and reliability requirements for various types of products.
Provide input on product concepts and samples.
Write test plans to ensure products meet or exceed all global regulatory standards.
Conduct risk assessments to address product-specific safety and reliability concerns.
Interpret test reports and align with team regarding appropriate action plans.
Monitor consumer complaints; review product returns from our Consumer Care team; implement corrective actions as needed.
Continuously learn more about the continuously evolving global toy standards.
Represent the Quality Assurance team in cross-functional development meetings.
Communicate with Hasbro Far East employees via email and video conferencing.
Play with TOYS!
What You’ll Bring:
A passion for making the world a better place for all children and all families.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Minimum Education level: BS Electrical, Mechanical, or Chemical Engineering (or related field).
Up to 2 years of work experience in a consumer product manufacturing, quality, product development or test lab environment (related internship and co-op experience included).
Hasbro’s world-class brands and talented people are our greatest assets. One of the ways we invest in you is through a competitive and contemporary benefits package. Your particular benefits package will depend on your position, location, local legal requirements and years with the company. Here’s a look at what your benefits package may include: Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance, Half-day Fridays year round, Paid Vacation Time & Holidays, Generous 401(k) match, Paid Parental Leave, Team Hasbro Volunteer Program, Employee Giving & Matching Gifts Programs, Tuition Reimbursement, Toy Discounts and more!

Join us and be part of crafting the world’s best play experiences!

Hasbro is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. Description

Position at SEGA Development Services

FIXED TERM CONTRACT
LOCALISATION TEAM
BASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORD, WEST LONDON
REPORTING TO THE LOCALISATION QA PROJECT MANAGERS

A BIT ABOUT SEGA
SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our five development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.
At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Tech, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.
Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.

WORKING THE SEGA WAY
We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours…
For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our lunchtime gaming sessions in our games lounge, regular gaming tournaments and free SEGA games on Steam
If you're more of a foodie, you can take advantage of Icecream Wednesdays or our fresh fruit and cereal every single day
Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership, ride to work scheme, workout area and bootcamps in the park. You can find your zen with weekly yoga classes as well as in-house massage therapy
You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be
We hold regular lunch & learn sessions, company updates at the world-famous BAFTA theatre in Central London and Summer and Christmas parties that you’ll want to brag to your mates about! What’s not to love?
We pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of the office
We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!
And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Check out our Careers website to find out why we are a workplace you’ll never want to leave!

POSITION OVERVIEW
As a Localisation QA Tester, you will be responsible of testing SEGA products and verifying any localised assets. You’ll be responsible for linguistic quality and ensuring that the correct terminology and glossaries are used for the assigned title. You’ll also assist with casting and audio and any localised material checks within Localisation QA.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Test SEGA products for linguistic correctness.
Run test cases and localisation checks in the respective language.
Identify linguistic issues and report them in the bug database, suggesting fixes to defect/bugs within the assigned products.
Edit and fix master text files/text databases and provide translation as necessary.
Complete localisation compliance checks.
Verify localised assets related to the product in testing.
Support with audio casting and the audio assets verification process.
Provide translation support when necessary.
Provide feedback on the testing process, suggesting improvements and sharing knowledge with the team.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Experienced gamer, able to adapt to any game genre with ease.
Excellent linguistic knowledge and deep understanding of the contracted language.
Clear, concise and professional communicator, both in English and in the contracted language.
High proficiency with Microsoft Office.
Reliable, with high work standards and the willingness to meet and exceed expectations.
Flexible and adaptable to different LQA tasks and projects.
Proven ability to maintain focus and commitment.
Passion and enthusiasm for the role and the company, team player.

About Aetna

Aetna are a leading diversified health care benefits company, serving an estimated 44 million people. We offer industry-leading information, tools and resources to help people achieve their best possible health. A Fortune 5 company, Aetna is the third largest health care benefits company in the United States.

Aetna's global business, Aetna International, is one of the world's largest and most prominent providers, with more than 650,000 members worldwide and a direct settlement network of over 125,000 hospitals and clinics.

Aetna is about more than just doing a job. This is our opportunity to re-shape healthcare across the globe. We are a company built on excellence. We have a culture that values growth, achievement and diversity and a workplace where your voice can be heard.

As well as some excellent benefits and a fantastic working environment, we will give you the space to grow and provide you with opportunities to learn new skills to keep you developing personally and professionally.

Join us and help turn health ambitions into achievements.

About the role

As the Quality Analyst, you will be acting as an advocate, supporting the business by serving as a quality champion through measuring and monitoring the quality and effectiveness of work processes in customer service that impacts customer satisfaction, medical cost management and operational efficiency.

Your typical day will include:
Conducting standard quality reviews /audits to measure compliance with published policies, procedures, customer and regulatory guidelines
Quality check all touchpoints in the customer journey, including the triage and investigation of the complaint, the quality of our response
Quality check enquiries to ensure that the correct classification decision has been made and that the customer has received a correct and comprehensive response to their question/request for action.
Correctly communicate monitoring results and provide feedback in a clear and concise manner.
Ensure good customer outcomes are at the centre of decision making,
What you'll need

• Previous experience within a similar role
• Previous experience working within the insurance industry
• A high level of problem-solving skills and the ability to resolve issues.
• Ability to manage own workload, prioritising tasks appropriately and ensuring that SLAs are achieved.
• You'll take a methodical approach to your work and have excellent attention to detail
• You'll be great team player and a strong communicator
• A customer centric approach

The Perks

• Competitive salary
• Discretionary annual bonus
• 7% Company Pension
• Private healthcare
• We'll help you grow by providing support for your professional development
• Fresh fruit and drinks
• Monthly employee appreciation lunches
• Social activities - we work hard but like to have fun too!
• Well-being initiatives

We'd love to hear from you, so don't forget to follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or find us on Facebook!
Location: Farnborough, Hampshire, South East England, England

Software Quality Assurance Tester (Cambridge, UK)

Mon, June 22, 2020


Software Quality Assurance Tester

inMusic Brands (the parent company which owns Akai Professional, Alesis, Numark, Air, Denon DJ, M-Audio and other pro-audio brands) is looking for a full-time QA professional to join our team developing industry-leading audio products, electronic musical instruments, music production kit, the iconic MPC line, DJ products, and more.

Our UK development office is based in central Cambridge.

We have a great development team, and the projects are genuinely interesting.

Job Description

The Quality Assurance Tester is responsible for creating and executing test cases for a wide range of music industry products introduced by inMusic Brand’s global development teams. The ideal tester brings a keen troubleshooting mind and a general love for audio gear, production and performance. He or she should also possess strong written and oral communications skills, and the ability to work independently or in a collaborative setting.

The inMusic Brands family, with headquarters in Rhode Island, USA, has offices all over the world. You will interact with an international team of professionals.

Job responsibilities include:
Create and execute detailed test plans for new products.
Maintain software quality for existing products.
Maintain testing status/progress using standard bug tracking tools.
Advise approval of final code/hardware components.
Qualifications

Must Haves
2- 4 years’ commercial experience in test or quality assurance roles
Good electronic and digital music production skills
Proven ability to design and architect high quality, reliable software test assets including test design, approach, scripts and bugs.
Full lifecycle experience in multiple software projects, from inception, planning, development, test, deployment and maintenance.
Experienced with Microsoft Office Suite.
Experienced with both Windows and Mac OSX platforms.
Strong written and spoken communication skills.
Excellent problem-solving approach
Fluent spoken and good written English.
Nice to have
A degree-level qualification in Computer Sciences, Electronic Music Production, Audio Engineering, general music practices/performance, or a related field.
Experience with scripting languages and test automation frameworks.
In depth knowledge of MIDI Communications protocol.
Software development background.
We will not consider agency applications for this post.

Are you detail-oriented, with strong communication skills? If you are interested in working with product and software development, this could be the role for you!
Position summary
The Quality Analyst ensures testing is completed in order to identify mistakes and defects when delivering our software solutions. Provide confidence to internal and external teams that quality requirements are fulfilled.
Key responsibilities
Execute testing to validate functionality in all phases of testing to ensure the software meets a defined set of specifications
Perform sanity tests
Track and report all defects from identification to resolution
Uphold and adhere to testing best practices at all times
Update and maintain testing documentation
Participates in continuous improvement efforts in test coverage and effectiveness
Provide creative and flexible solutions in a rapidly-changing work environment
Communicate appropriately and effectively with cross functional teams
Contribute as the subject matter expert for Quality during client implementation

Self-starter with the ability to rapidly grasp and apply complex business and technical concepts
Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook experience
Clear communicator (written and verbal)-must have the ability to document issues clearly and communication with various departments in the organization.
Ability to focus on deadlines and deliverables- able to complete tasks in a defined time frame.
Ability to think abstractly- thinking about how the application functions and if things do not make sense.
Attention to detail- must be able to clearly document testing issues found and look for impact items, both large and small.

Date Posted:

2020-01-05-08:00

Country:

United Kingdom

Location:

Otis Chiswick Park, Building 5 Ground Floor, 566 Chiswick High Road, London, W4 5YF, UK.

Great brands have a great story. Ours is legendary.

In 1854, Elisha Otis travelled to the New York World's Fair to promote his new invention. Standing high above the crowd on a platform elevator, he ordered the retaining rope cut. The crowd cried out. His safety brake held. And in that moment, one man changed the world's perspective on what's possible, sending it rising up.

Would you like to join a truly international, talent driven company with values that focus on Performance, Quality, Innovation and Employee Opportunity?

The Role

We have an excellent opportunity for an experienced Lift Tester who is looking to develop their career with a world renowned company. We are currently looking to recruit a Modernisation Lift Tester/ Technician to provide senior level technical support to the Modernisation business and be competent with Otis and third party equipment.
You will test complex multi-unit sites with highly technical interfaces such as Compass, Elevator Management System (EMS) and third party destination control systems; this includes high speed gearless units and escalators
You will also provide technical support on site to other engineers for the purpose of up-skilling, audit handover and compliance and carry out client liaison during fault finding activities
Required Experience
You will be NVQ Level 4 qualified with experience from within the lift industry as a Tester/ Technician
You will possess knowledge of electrical and mechanical engineering principles and relevant lift codes such as EN81 Part 2, etc.
Whilst you must be a team player it is essential that you can also work on your own initiative
Hard-working and loyal, promoting and working to the required Otis Health and Safety standards at all times.
We are interested in receiving applications from talented and ambitious Lift Testers and Lift Technicians, who live within a reasonable commute of London and who have a valid Driving License.

Salary and Benefits
On top of a competitive basic salary you will receive a company vehicle, overtime and other allowances
Benefits which include pension, 33 days holiday (including bank holidays), Life Assurance, Childcare Vouchers, Paid Maternity, Paternity and Sick leave, reduced rate private medical insurance, and access to the Otis Rewards Scheme
Employer Description

Otis is the world leader in reliable, efficient and technologically advanced elevators, escalators and people-moving systems. Our revolutionary Gen2® elevators, energy-saving ReGen™ drives and NCE “green” escalator have clearly set the industry standard for innovation, safety and performance. More than 2.4 million Otis elevators and escalators are currently in operation throughout 200 different countries. We are proud to have a global team that continues to rise to the challenges of a fast-moving company. Together, the people of Otis are creating new ideas and opportunities by collaborating across time zones, geographies and cultures. So just imagine where we can take you!

We are a company with a big commitment to the continuing development of everyone who works for us, strongly supporting career progression and facilitating a culture which encourages innovative ideas and appreciate that our talent is the key to our success.

Otis is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Job Title: Automation QA Tester/Test Analyst/Automation Tester/QA Tester
Job Description:
Job Description
Automation QA Tester/Test Analyst/Tester/Automation Tester/QA Tester is urgently required by our Global IT Services Company for an initial 5 months rolling contract, to be based remotely from home.
Responsibilities & Skills:
The successful applicant will be an Automation QA Tester required to help with the delivery of the automation testing, creating test plans to ensure full coverage as well as drive and lead the implementation of best practice throughout the whole lifecycle with shift left approaches as default.
The automation QA tester will own and manage all test activities surrounding automation testing, driving CI/CD and advocating a shift-left mentality through TDD/BDD, conducting regular functional and regression testing, and working with management to ensure smooth release. This role requires regular communication with senior stakeholders so confident and concise communication is necessary to succeed in this role.
Provides specialist testing advice and delivery, is accountable for managing automation testing activities on projects within a program or service.
Working as part of a DevOps/Agile squad
Understands the requirements for testing within projects and agrees testing scope with stakeholders
Accountable for the delivery of testing activities within budget and timescale
Work with product owners to define acceptance criteria and the Definition of Done.
Creates test plan documents that address the requirements and mitigate the risks of the solution
Contributes to internal testing standards
Accurately evaluate and report test results, test progress, and product quality
Knowledge of automation test tools including open source
Agile testing in Scrum
TDD implementation and optimisation & BDD acceptance criteria understanding and execution
Capable of assisting developers with unit testing & agile test members with component integration testing
Development and implementation of end-to-end automated testing solution
Advocate for freeware, shift left and CI/CD
ISQTB certification or equivalent
Coding experience - able to contribute to coding sprints
Automation experience e.g. Selenium, Java, AngularJS, JS and C#
Knowledge of Git, GitHub, TFS, Jenkins
Clouds services, e.g. AWS, Azure
API Services - RESTful, POSTman
Hands on work experience in e.g. JUnit, NUnit and TestNG
Experience in CI/CD e.g. Cucumber, Slack, Serenity, SpecFlow
Executing the Test Cycles, Monitoring and analysis of Results
Creation of Test Report and conveying key aspects to Customer in both Technical and non-Technical terminology
This is an urgent requirement; please apply as soon as possible if you would like to be considered. If you would like further details, please contact me on; in/cassandrebutcheruk.
The Company
A leading global IT services organisation with 10,000 employees and annual revenue of nearly £2 billion in the UK alone. Projects delivered for private, Government, International and Defence customers are some of the largest and most technically innovative solutions found in the world. Their business is rapidly expanding to meet current and future commitments due to numerous exciting programmes currently being developed. These solutions will use the latest technology to resolve some of the most complex requirements for a challenging group of customers.
Diversity
Project People and our clients are fully committed to developing an inclusive workforce. Applications are always fully considered, irrespective of race, gender, faith, sexual orientation, ethnic origin or part-time status.
Project People is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

As a Localisation QA Tester, you’ll be the key point of contact for your language within Localisation QA. You will test SEGA products and verify any localised assets, whilst guiding and mentoring the less experienced testers in the team. You’ll be responsible for linguistic quality and ensuring that the correct terminology and glossaries are used for the relevant territory. You’ll also assist with casting and audio and will be the final point of escalation to ensure quality within the language.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Test SEGA products for linguistic correctness.
• Run test cases and localisation checks in the respective language.
• Identify linguistic issues and report them in the bug database, suggesting fixes to defect/bugs within the assigned products.
• Edit and fix master text files/text databases and provide translation as necessary.
• Complete localisation compliance checks and act as a point of reference for naming conventions for the assigned language.
• Verify localised assets related to the product in testing.
• Support with audio casting and the audio assets verification process, acting as the final point of escalation for your territory.
• Review and verify the team’s bugs, edits and suggestions for correctness, grammar/spelling and adherence to first party terminology and internal glossaries.
• Ensure consistency of process is applied within your respective language team.
• Provide feedback and linguistic/IP direction for the testing team and external translators in order to maintain quality and consistency within the language and the products.
• Be a point of reference and final point of escalation for the relevant language within the Localisation Department.
• Act as a guide and mentor to the less experienced testers on the relevant language.
• Create standardised and measurable quality report on the assigned language.
• Work together with the broader localisation team to maintain glossaries for the SEGA IPs for the assigned languages.
• Provide performance review data to the LQA Project Managers and Associate Leads.
• When necessary, support the LQA Project Managers and LQA Associate Leads with project administration.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
• Experienced tester, able to tackle the most challenging tasks with ease and adapt to any project requirement.
• Excellent knowledge of SEGA’s IPs and products.
• Excellent working knowledge of the software tools in use at SEGA (test case management and text editing tools).
• Excellent knowledge of first party naming conventions.
• Working knowledge of CAT tools (MemoQ).
• Excellent linguistic knowledge and deep understanding of your contracted language.
• Understanding of the linguistic trends and consumer expectations of the target market, able to deliver precise, relevant and resonant language for that territory and IP.
• Clear, concise and professional communicator, both in English and your contracted language.
• High proficiency with Microsoft Office.
• Reliable, with high work standards and the willingness to meet and exceed expectations.
• Flexible and adaptable to different LQA tasks and projects.
• Proven ability to maintain focus and commitment.
• Passion and enthusiasm for the role and the company, capable of motivating and inspire others.

The Role
At KPMG we are looking for a Manager who lives and breathes hacking and information security. You will have earned your stripes doing CHECK work in data centres and be ready to, or already skilled in leading teams of talented testers.
In return we will provide some of the UK’s most unique government and commercial engagements for you to cut your teeth on and a friendly, passionate team to develop and grow.
The KPMG’s Cyber Defence (CDS) Team conducts client facing technical assurance and penetration testing and has a long and successful history in KPMG. Our clients are diverse and we cover many sectors with particular specialisms in Financial Services, High-end Defence Assurance and Telecommunications. We work closely with the NCSC developing new schemes such as Cross Domain Solutions Testing (https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/blog-post/ncsc-cross-domain-industry-pilot-stage-2) and are members of all current NCSC and CREST testing schemes - as a result we conduct interesting and challenging work that isn’t on offer elsewhere.
Our team is made up of skilled individuals at different stages in their careers, centred around three locations in Leeds, Bristol and London, therefore we are able to offer flexibility in base location, as well as embracing remote working.
Responsibilities
As this is a senior role, we want your business brain as well as your technical hacking skills. You will have ideas of how to drive the business forward, and be skilled in the commercial aspects of security testing, above all you will know what clients are looking for when they buy security testing and how to deliver it.
Aspects of the role include:
• Management and delivery of penetration testing services to clients to include the following:
o Scoping
o Financial and risk management
o Delivery of testing and the oversight of testers
o Review of deliverables (QA)
• Coaching and developing team members through sharing of experience and knowledge.
• Performance management of junior staff.
• Continuous development of self and team, including managing client feedback.
• Developing constructive client relationships, both inside and outside of KPMG.
• Developing an understanding of KPMG’s broader offerings to enable identification of business opportunities
• Business development including contributing to proposals and participating in client presentations.
Experience and Background

Required
• Passion for Hacking!
• Clear and demonstrable understanding of penetration testing and red-teaming including NCSC and CREST accredited schemes.
• Proven experience of successfully managing and delivering testing
• Proven experience working within the UK cyber security industry
• Demonstrable understanding and practical application of information security principles
• Strong technical background in computing, networks, and programming.
• Proven experience of producing high quality deliverables working alone and as part of a team.
• Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
• Experience leading, coaching and mentoring highly technical teams
• A genuine interest and desire to work with large multi-national clients in the information security field.
Advantageous:
• Knowledge of NCSC CTAS and CPA Assurance Schemes
• Knowledge of working in secure environments (List X facilities) and accredited labs (ISO17025)
• Research and Development experience
• Threat Intelligence experience
Qualifications and Skills

Qualifications are a good way to demonstrate knowledge but are not the be all and end all, our team is made up of a large number of individuals with diverse backgrounds who all share the “hacker mindset”.
If you have the experience then we want you to apply. Didn’t do a degree in information security? A-Levels weren’t as good as you hoped. Haven’t attended every SANS course going, we don’t mind!
For this role we only have two formal requirements.
• CCT-App or CCT-INF.
• UK Government Security Clearance – the ability to apply for and hold SC is required, DV is advantageous.
Above all, KPMG is looking for someone who is passionate about helping our clients (including the UK Government) with their cyber security challenges. In return, we are committed to helping you enjoy the role and develop your skills and career within the KPMG network.

Software Test Engineer

Spring Technology are currently working in partnership with a market leading software solutions provider in Gloucester to recruit a number of Test Engineers to join and be a part of a growing successful development team

The Role
As a Software Test Engineer your role will be testing web based applications, RESTful APIs and mobile applications using manual testing methodologies for quality assurance purposes. You will contribute to leading edge applications and play a large part in the delivery of software in a fast paced agile environment.

The Responsibilities
Testing new features and fixes ensuring everything works and prioritising issues
Creating scenarios to aid the development of automated tests
Ensuring quality assurance compliance with ISO standards
Liaise with product and development teams to feedback any software or usability issues

The Requirements
Commercial experience as a Software test engineer with strong demonstrable skills
An understanding of an agile environment and the ability to work to tight deadlines
A passion for creating great user experiences
Excellent communication both orally and written
Scripting experience and test management application experience is desirable

If you are looking for an exciting new challenge to join a flourishing development team please apply now.

Spring acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. The Spring Group UK is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Spring. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explains how we will use your information - please copy and paste the following link in to your browser: www.spring.com/candidate-privacy-information-statement

Description

Position at SEGA Development Services

FIXED TERM CONTRACT

LOCALISATION TEAM

BASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORD, WEST LONDON

REPORTING TO THE LOCALISATION QA PROJECT MANAGERS

A BIT ABOUT SEGA


SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our five development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.

At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Tech, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.

Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.

WORKING THE SEGA WAY


We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours…
For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our lunchtime gaming sessions in our games lounge, regular gaming tournaments and free SEGA games on Steam
If you're more of a foodie, you can take advantage of Icecream Wednesdays or our fresh fruit and cereal every single day
Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership, ride to work scheme, workout area and bootcamps in the park. You can find your zen with weekly yoga classes as well as in-house massage therapy
You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be
We hold regular lunch & learn sessions, company updates at the world-famous BAFTA theatre in Central London and Summer and Christmas parties that you’ll want to brag to your mates about! What’s not to love?
We pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of the office
We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!
And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Check out our Careers website to find out why we are a workplace you’ll never want to leave!



POSITION OVERVIEW


As a Localisation QA Tester, you will be responsible of testing SEGA products and verifying any localised assets. You’ll be responsible for linguistic quality and ensuring that the correct terminology and glossaries are used for the assigned title. You’ll also assist with casting and audio and any localised material checks within Localisation QA.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Test SEGA products for linguistic correctness.
Run test cases and localisation checks in the respective language.
Identify linguistic issues and report them in the bug database, suggesting fixes to defect/bugs within the assigned products.
Edit and fix master text files/text databases and provide translation as necessary.
Complete localisation compliance checks.
Verify localised assets related to the product in testing.
Support with audio casting and the audio assets verification process.
Provide translation support when necessary.
Provide feedback on the testing process, suggesting improvements and sharing knowledge with the team.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Experienced gamer, able to adapt to any game genre with ease.
Excellent linguistic knowledge and deep understanding of the contracted language.
Clear, concise and professional communicator, both in English and in the contracted language.
High proficiency with Microsoft Office.
Reliable, with high work standards and the willingness to meet and exceed expectations.
Flexible and adaptable to different LQA tasks and projects.
Proven ability to maintain focus and commitment.
Passion and enthusiasm for the role and the company, team player.

Commerce Manual Tester required and should possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills and have an eye for detail. We require a highly motivated individual with well-developed interpersonal skills. You will be part of a small team of testers, primarily focused on retail eCommerce sites. You will be involved in the preparation of test cases, test plans and will be required to execute tests both manually and where necessary using automated testing tools.

The applicant will be system testing and integration testing on new projects and regression testing as part of on-going site support for a number of clients. Experience of testing RESTful services, querying databases and reviewing log file output is expected.

You…

Talented, enthusiastic, focused, eye for detail, professional. Keen to learn and find new ways of doing things. A team player who is proud of your work and wants to share with everyone! You like working in a fast paced environment and are driven by the desire to improve the online purchasing experience for everyone, no matter what they are buying and from where!

You will be client focused and be willing to be flexible when required to make them happy, including working at client locations.

The techy bit….we need you to be really great at:
System Testing experience.
Experience of testing transactional eCommerce websites, ideally retail based.
Be able to analyse requirements, identify testable conditions and write concise test scripts.
High level of communication and interpersonal skills including experience of writing accurate and concise reports.
Experience of liaising with customer and external third parties.
Experience of querying databases using SQL.
Full knowledge of the project lifecycle and experience of various project development methodologies.
Basic Knowledge of UNIX.
Experience of testing RESTful services either manually or using tools such as Postman or ReadyAPI (SoapUI).
Be able to review server log files and identify errors.
If you know some of this even better!
Retail sector, warehouse or fulfilment experience.
Hands on usage of Selenium or other automation tools
Knowledge of the following technologies; Java, J2EE, DB2, DB Visualizer, SQL, XML, UNIX and MQ Series (IBM WebSphere Commerce would be good).
Some exposure to pre-sales engagements and proposal writing.
Hands on experience of JIRA, Confluence or other Atlassian tools.
Experience of HTML, Flash and JavaScript.
Wunderman Thompson Commerce is a new global eCommerce consultancy that applies strategy, technical know-how and outstanding design to make a big impact through eCommerce.

How? By creating outstanding websites and inspired shopper journeys. It’s why we work with some of the most exciting brands around such as Tempur, DFS, Boots, Xerox, Sainsbury’s, Selfridges, Specialized and Ted Baker.

Tell me more! We’re an inclusive group of more than 1350 thinkers and doers from WPP’s leading commerce agencies: Salmon, POSSIBLE Commerce and Gorilla Group alongside two Amazon specialists - all under the world-renowned Wunderman brand. Our reputation is based on having the best the business – people who are inspired yet straight-talking, and who really want to understand not just our clients but their customers. We are passionate about innovation in everything we do, and proud of what our people achieve, empowering and respecting every one of them.

Together, we keep our clients and their customers inspired and ahead through digital, future-ready sites, solutions and services. When our clients win – we win.

With new, state-of-the-art offices in Watford, and two other cool agency offices in Central London, we’ve got 20 locations mapped across Europe, North America and Asia.

As our business grows internationally, we’re seeking new people who share our values and work ethic. We especially want to encourage more women to join, and take a key role in shaping some of the best eCommerce sites and experiences in the world.

Would you like to be a part of a team to build a better future for better-connected lives for generations to come?
An alt network seeks experienced a Quality Assurance Lead like you to support their next stage of growth.
Reporting into the Senior Project Manager, you will work collaboratively with the contractor notifying them at the earliest opportunity of potential risks to reduce the exposure of fines from the County Council across various towns dotted throughout the Home Counties.
Sounds good?
Then you must be able to demonstrate an in depth knowledge of HAUC SRoH specification.
Be able to record the exact geo location of the laid apparatus including civils trenching, POT position, chambers, aerial nodes, PN's and SN's and cabinets.
Be present on site at the time when the contractor is conducting the OTDR fibre testing and sign off.
Send completed sections of the built network to the Design Manager and supervisor for final sign off to become internal "As Built" drawings. As well as being able to upload frozen designs to Line Search Before You Dig so location of the apparatus is available for all other utility companies working in the area in future.
Be able to create a RAG status for number of potential defects and share on a regular basis with the Project Supervisor.
You will also have a minimum of 3 years prior experience in supporting Project Supervisors who are responsible for large scale telecoms projects deploying FTTH is essential gained from working on Openreach PIA engineering rules and build specifications.
You will be responsible for signing off the testing results of the ducts and fibre. Notify the supervisor of any defects and attend the pressure testing of the ducts and report to the supervisor any defects. Ensure the tester is using the correct specified equipment as recommended by the duct manufacturer.
Next steps?
To apply, please send your CV in the first instance.

Location:
Godalming

Salary:
£25,000 - £35,000

Type:
Permanent

Sector:
Technical

Overview
2i Recruit’s client are an established, dynamic and successful software company, supplying leading edge software applications with their spot. They are a market leader worldwide, with an enviable list of major household names as customers.
Due to continued success and growth they have an exciting opportunity for someone to champion data quality within their QA team. This is a key role within the organisations Quality Assurance team. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing confidence in the product, as well as reviewing existing manual test structures and taking part in exploratory testing.

THE ROLE
Identify quality risks and issues
Develop mitigation plans and drive them to completion
Ensure releases have low data quality risk
Feed our innovation cycle with continuous improvements to help customers manage data quality
Responsibilities
Use analytical techniques, exploratory testing & regression testing to pro-actively identify quality risks & issues
Document risks & issues and work with others in the organisation to mitigate them
Extend quality test coverage by developing new tests, plans and suites
Brief automation engineers to enable them to extend the coverage of automated tests
Assess work items for quality risks at the user acceptance level and sign them off for release
Maintain allergen risk test plans

Experience & Attributes Required
A motivating, positive and can do attitude
Highly organized and able to multi-task.
Self-driven and proactive nature.
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
A strong strategic vision for quality assurance
Passion for great service.
Proactive, motivated, calm and show initiative, friendly with a good sense of humour
Commercially aware
Structured, focused on priorities and competent in building relationships within teams
Experience within a fast paced, dynamic and entrepreneurial SME company
Between 1 to 3 years’ experience in Quality Assurance
You have experience managing test plans and developing test structures
Applying technical related skills, with knowledge of Selenium & C#

If you have not been contacted within 5 working days, then unfortunately on this occasion your CV has not been shortlisted.

You’ll also assist with casting and audio and any localised material checks within Localisation QA.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Test SEGA products for linguistic correctness.
Run test cases and localisation checks in the respective language.
Identify linguistic issues and report them in the bug database, suggesting fixes to defect/bugs within the assigned products.
Edit and fix master text files/text databases and provide translation as necessary.
Complete localisation compliance checks.
Verify localised assets related to the product in testing.
Support with audio casting and the audio assets verification process.
Provide translation support when necessary.
Provide feedback on the testing process, suggesting improvements and sharing knowledge with the team.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Experienced gamer, able to adapt to any game genre with ease.
Excellent linguistic knowledge and deep understanding of the contracted language.
Clear, concise and professional communicator, both in English and in the contracted language.
High proficiency with Microsoft Office.
Reliable, with high work standards and the willingness to meet and exceed expectations.
Flexible and adaptable to different LQA tasks and projects.
Proven ability to maintain focus and commitment.
Passion and enthusiasm for the role and the company, team player.

Description


FIXED TERM CONTRACT
LOCALISATION TEAM
BASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORD, WEST LONDON
REPORTING TO THE LOCALISATION QA PROJECT MANAGERS

A BIT ABOUT SEGA
SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our five development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.
At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Tech, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.
Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.

WORKING THE SEGA WAY
We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours…
For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our lunchtime gaming sessions in our games lounge, regular gaming tournaments and free SEGA games on Steam
If you're more of a foodie, you can take advantage of Icecream Wednesdays or our fresh fruit and cereal every single day
Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership, ride to work scheme, workout area and bootcamps in the park. You can find your zen with weekly yoga classes as well as in-house massage therapy
You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be
We hold regular lunch & learn sessions, company updates at the world-famous BAFTA theatre in Central London and Summer and Christmas parties that you’ll want to brag to your mates about! What’s not to love?
We pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of the office
We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!
And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Check out our Careers website to find out why we are a workplace you’ll never want to leave!

Mobile Quality Assurance Engineer | London
At Cambridge Audio, we want you to hear your music at it’s very best, as the artist intended it to be heard, with nothing added, nothing taken away. That’s what we’ve always wanted because that’s what music lovers like us deserve. It’s why we we’re constantly experimenting, solving problems and creating new kit. It’s why we’ve been doing what we do for the last 50+ years. It’s why we’re always trying to make the listening experience better. Pure. However you listen, whatever your budget, our goal is simple: Give you the best possible sound, at the fairest possible price.
Our engineering department encompasses many disciplines; industrial design, electronics, embedded software and mobile application development are all carried out by dedicated team of music lovers on a mission to produce audio equipment that faithfully creates a pure and natural sound. Nothing added, nothing taken away.
We’re looking for a Mobile QA Engineer to join our Engineering team.
We’re a business full of great people who are encouraged to develop their careers and push their own creativity and progression. To find out more about us, visit: www.cambridgeaudio.com/about-us
Job Description
As part of a rapidly changing technological environment our products are constantly evolving; our user experience is now more important than ever and to ensure we continue to deliver class leading products we’re investing in a team dedicated to progressing the user interfaces of our products.
Working in an agile scrum team you’ll be responsible for working with designers, and mobile and embedded software developers to make sure our apps and product interfaces meet the high standards expected by our customers.
You will be an advocate for quality and the voice of the end user, participating in design reviews and discussions relating to proposed features and the overall app experience.
Benefits of Mobile Quality Assurance Engineer:
Company pension
Work from home
Key Responsibilities of Mobile Quality Assurance Engineer
Ensure the high quality of our mobile applications through testing and collaboration
Define and perform acceptance, functional and integration tests
Participate as an integral member of our agile team to ensure stories contain relevant and useful acceptance criteria
Develop and manage complete and efficient test cases during sprints in order to verify acceptance criteria has been met
Track test cases, bugs and stories to ensure we maintain a full history of our workflow
Requirements of Mobile Quality Assurance Engineer
Strong and demonstrable passion for teamwork
Ability to develop new skills quickly and adapt to working with new products and processes
Experience of quality assurance processes, test planning, execution and reporting
Understanding of Agile/Scrum working practices
Experience testing in iOS and Android mobile environments including a good, working knowledge of Apple and Google UX guidelines
Good verbal and written skills and an ability to communicate at all levels
Experience | Tools
Agile/Scrum working practices and
Servers and connected device interaction
Basic networking and IT technology
Automated testing software
Project management/reporting tools e.g. Jira
Knowledge sharing tools e.g. Confluence
Test case management tools e.g. Cucumber Studio, Test Rail, etc.
Proxy tools e.g Proxyman, Charles Proxy, etc.
To apply, please apply via our website at: www.cambridgeaudio.com/gbr/en/careers
All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Company pension
Work from home

Monday to Friday

Android/iOS QA: 2 years (Preferred)

Quality Assurance: 3 years (Required)

Bachelor's (Preferred)

Yes, always

Required:
Strong Data Quality skills (Dimensions, measurements, profiling, matching)
Exposure in DQ environment
Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or higher - Advanced

Excellent analytical skills

Self-motivated organised professional, who takes responsibility for their work, capable of being highly productive in a home based work environment.
